dt.t: … his explanation of a piano's key action will leave you more {wi}baffled{/wi} than before.
Molecular biologists became even more {wi}baffled{/wi} when they looked at the messenger RNAs: many of the molecules were longer than the DNA from which they had been transcribed.
In Miss Kate's eyes there was a troubled, {wi}baffled{/wi} look …
We have all heard novelists testify to the fact that, beginning a new book, they are utterly {wi}baffled{/wi} as to how to proceed …
Ventilation openings are {wi}baffled{/wi} to prevent stray light from reaching the operator's eyes …
A {wi}baffled{/wi} fuel cell keeps the weight in place.

dt: {bc}to defeat or check (someone) by confusing or puzzling {bc}to confuse or frustrate completely {bc}{sx|disconcert||}
{bc}to check or break the force or flow of by or as if by a baffle {dx_def}see {dxt|baffle:2||}{/dx_def}

pt: {sc}frustrate{/sc} {sc}thwart{/sc} {sc}foil{/sc} {sc}baffle{/sc} {sc}balk{/sc} mean to check or defeat another's plan or block achievement of a goal. {sc}frustrate{/sc} implies making vain or ineffectual all efforts however vigorous or persistent.
{sc}thwart{/sc} suggests frustration or checking by crossing or opposing.

pt.t: the army {it}thwarted{/it} his attempt at a coup

pt: {sc}foil{/sc} implies checking or defeating so as to discourage further effort.

pt.t: {it}foiled{/it} by her parents, he stopped trying to see her

pt: {sc}baffle{/sc} implies frustration by confusing or puzzling.

pt.t: {it}baffled{/it} by the maze of rules and regulations

pt: {sc}balk{/sc} suggests the interposing of obstacles or hindrances.

pt.t: officials felt that legal restrictions had {it}balked{/it} their efforts to control crime

et: probably alteration of Middle English (Scots) {it}bawchillen{/it} to denounce, discredit publicly
shortdef: to defeat or check (someone) by confusing or puzzling : to confuse or frustrate completely : disconcert
to check or break the force or flow of by or as if by a baffle

dt: {bc}a device (such as a plate, wall, or screen) to deflect, check, or regulate flow or passage (as of a fluid, light, or sound)

shortdef: a device (such as a plate, wall, or screen) to deflect, check, or regulate flow or passage (as of a fluid, light, or sound)
